title: Science Inquiry Projects Through Embodied Collaborative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Science learning environment integrating physical activities using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners improve spatial reasoning skills by over 20% through body-based collaborative activities.
Learners can develop role-distribution and communication strategies when performing group tasks (3-person teams).

Over a six-month course, learners observe physical contact patterns (handshakes, shoulder taps, gestures, etc.) during collaborative learning activities (group discussions, experiments) and collect frequency data for at least three types, then create a learning style (active/reflective/observing/auditory) diagnostic checklist with 80% accuracy.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
